newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Grosvenor Trust to raise A$124 mln.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Grosvenor Trust to raise A$124 mln.

text.p: BT Funds Management Ltd, manager of Grosvenor Trust, said the trust plans to raise A$124 million through a 3-for-10 rights issue at A$1.42 per unit.
BT said a prospectus had been lodged on Monday with the Australian Securities Commission.
It said about 87.36 million new units would be offered, with the issue fully underwritten by HSBC James Capel Australia.
"The purpose of the issue is to finance the acquisition of six adjoining Sydney properties at 185 Macquarie Street, 69 Hunter Street and 124, 130, 140 and 142 Phillip Street," BT said.
The total purchase price would be A$107 million and costs of A$6.0 million, with some additional working capital to be provided.
"The acquisition is considered to have significant benefits," BT said.

"It increases the trust's investment in the Sydney office market which continues to offer a very positive outlook for both rental and capital growth provides the prospect of attractive total returns comprising holding yield together with capital growth from the land and buildings."
